00033     Histogram2DCollection_t(const std::string &collection_name,
00034                             const EVENT::StringVec &name_list, UInt_t n_hist,
00035                             const HistPar &x_par,

00060     Histogram2DCollection_t(const std::string &collection_name,
00061                             const EVENT::StringVec &name_list, const lcio::IntVec &n_hist_list,
00062                             const HistPar &x_par,
00063                             const HistPar &y_par)
00064       : _histogramCol(0),
00065         _majorIndex(0)
00066     {
00067       createHistograms(collection_name,name_list, n_hist_list, x_par, y_par);
00068       //    __instances++;

00070 
00071 
00078     Histogram2DCollection_t(lcio::LCCollection *histograms, lcio::IntVec *indices)
00079       :_histogramCol(histograms),
00080        _majorIndex(0)
00081     {
00082       //    stat_copy(_histogramCol);
00083       if (indices) {
00084         if (indices->back()<histograms->getNumberOfElements()) {
00085           indices->push_back(histograms->getNumberOfElements());
00086         }
00087         // unfortunately there is currently no way to get the array which is attached to the LCIO collection.
00088         // so we have to maintain our own copy
00089         _majorIndex=new lcio::IntVec;
00090         _majorIndex->assign(indices->begin(),indices->end());
00091         histograms->parameters().setValues(__majorIndexParameterName,*indices);
00092       }
00093       //    __instances++;
00094     };
00095 
00105     Histogram2DCollection_t(lcio::LCCollection *histograms)
00106       : _histogramCol(histograms),
00107         _majorIndex(0)
00108     {
00109       //    stat_copy(_histogramCol);
00110       if (histograms->parameters().getNInt(__majorIndexParameterName)>0) {
00111         _majorIndex=new lcio::IntVec;
00112         histograms->parameters().getIntVals(__majorIndexParameterName,*_majorIndex);
00113       }
00114       //    __instances++;
00115     };
00116 
00119     Histogram2DCollection_t(const Histogram2DCollection_t &a)
00120       :_histogramCol(a._histogramCol),
00121        _majorIndex(0)
00122     {
00123       //    stat_copy(_histogramCol);
00124       if (a._majorIndex) {
00125         _majorIndex=new lcio::IntVec;
00126         _majorIndex->assign(a._majorIndex->begin(),a._majorIndex->end());
00127       }
00128       //    __instances++;
00129     };
00130 
00131 
00132     ~Histogram2DCollection_t() {
00133       // the histogram may not be owned by this wrapper, so it must not be deleted automatically.
00134       // The major index is always owned by this wrapper, so it should be deleted
00135       // The collections must be deleted manually. Otherwise whenever the HistogramCollection is passed
00136       // by value the collection will be deleted.
00137       delete _majorIndex;
00138     }
00139 
00140 
00143     Histogram2DCollection_t() : _histogramCol(0),_majorIndex(0) {};
00144 
00148     void deleteCollection() {
00149       //    stat_remove(_histogramCol);
00150       delete _histogramCol;
00151       _histogramCol=0;
00152       delete _majorIndex;
00153       _majorIndex=0;
00154     };
00155 
00156     void deleteSharedStorage() {
00157       deleteCollection();
00158     }

00218     UInt_t n() const {
00219       return _histogramCol->getNumberOfElements();
00220     }

00224     bool is2D() const {
00225       return _majorIndex && _majorIndex->size()>1;
00226     };
00227 
00230     UInt_t nMajor() const {
00231 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00232       assert(_majorIndex);
00233 #endif
00234       return _majorIndex->size()-1;
00235     };
00238     UInt_t nMinor(UInt_t major_index) const {
00239       return (*_majorIndex)[major_index+1]-(*_majorIndex)[major_index];
00240     };
00241 
00244     const FloatHistogram2D *histogram(UInt_t index) const {
00245 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00246       if (index>=static_cast<UInt_t>(_histogramCol->getNumberOfElements())) {
00247         std::stringstream message;
00248         message << "Range error accessing histogram " << index << ". Ther are only "
00249                 << _histogramCol->getNumberOfElements() << " histograms in the collection.";
00250         throw std::range_error(message.str());
00251       }
00252 #endif
00253       return dynamic_cast<FloatHistogram2D*>(_histogramCol->getElementAt(index));
00254     };
00255 
00258     FloatHistogram2D *histogram(UInt_t index)  {
00259 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00260       if (index>=static_cast<UInt_t>(_histogramCol->getNumberOfElements())) {
00261         std::stringstream message;
00262         message << "Range error accessing histogram " << index << ". Ther are only "
00263                 << _histogramCol->getNumberOfElements() << " histograms in the collection.";
00264         throw std::range_error(message.str());
00265       }
00266 #endif
00267       return dynamic_cast<FloatHistogram2D*>(_histogramCol->getElementAt(index));
00268     };
00269 
00272     FloatHistogram2D *histogram(UInt_t major_index, UInt_t minor_index)  {
00273 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00274       if (!_majorIndex) {
00275         throw std::logic_error("A major index was specified but the index collection does not exist.");
00276       }
00277 
00278       if (major_index>=_majorIndex->size()) {
00279         std::stringstream message;
00280         message << "Major index " << major_index << " out of ranger. The index collection contains only "
00281                 << _majorIndex->size() << " indices.";
00282         throw std::range_error(message.str());
00283       }
00284 #endif
00285 
00286       UInt_t index=(*_majorIndex)[major_index]+minor_index;
00287 
00288 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00289       if (index>=static_cast<UInt_t>(_histogramCol->getNumberOfElements())) {
00290         std::stringstream message;
00291         message << "Range error accessing histogram " << index << ". Ther are only "
00292                 << _histogramCol->getNumberOfElements() << " histograms in the collection.";
00293         throw std::range_error(message.str());
00294       }
00295 #endif
00296       return dynamic_cast<FloatHistogram2D*>(_histogramCol->getElementAt(index));
00297     };
00298 
00301     const FloatHistogram2D *histogram(UInt_t major_index, UInt_t minor_index) const {
00302 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00303       if (!_majorIndex) {
00304         throw std::logic_error("A major index was specified but the index collection does not exist.");
00305       }
00306 
00307       if (major_index>=_majorIndex->size()) {
00308         std::stringstream message;
00309         message << "Major index " << major_index << " out of ranger. The index collection contains only "
00310                 << _majorIndex->size() << " indices.";
00311         throw std::range_error(message.str());
00312       }
00313 #endif
00314 
00315       UInt_t index=(*_majorIndex)[major_index]+minor_index;
00316 
00317 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00318       if (index>=static_cast<UInt_t>(_histogramCol->getNumberOfElements())) {
00319         std::stringstream message;
00320         message << "Range error accessing histogram " << index << ". Ther are only "
00321                 << _histogramCol->getNumberOfElements() << " histograms in the collection.";
00322         throw std::range_error(message.str());
00323       }
00324 #endif
00325       return dynamic_cast<FloatHistogram2D*>(_histogramCol->getElementAt(index));
00326     };

00332     const std::string &getName(UInt_t major_index) const {
00333       if (_nameList.empty()) copyNames();
00334       if (_nameList.size()==1) {
00335         return _nameList[0];
00336       }
00337 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00338       assert( major_index < _nameList.size());
00339 #endif
00340       return _nameList[major_index];
00341     };

00362     void copyNames() const {
00363       if (_nameList.empty()) {
00364         _histogramCol->getParameters().getStringVals(__histogramNameParameterName,_nameList);
00365         if (_nameList.empty()) {
00366           _nameList.push_back(__defaultHistogramName);
00367         }
00368       }
00369     }
